data.title: The 50+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Shooting Guards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 50+ Best NBA Dallas Mavericks Shooting Guards. Current Top 3: Jason Terry, Vince Carter, Michael Finley
data.text:
Ranked By

1.0K votes

219 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Dallas Mavericks

Big fan of Dallas basketball? Then check out this list of Dallas Mavericks shooting guards. It includes almost every shooting guard from throughout Dallas Mavericks history, including current shooting guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA shooting guards of all time, the best Mavericks SGs include Michael Finley, Rolando Blackman, Jason Terry, and Jim Jackson.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Dallas Mavericks starting SGs and backup SGs are Tim Hardaway Jr., Josh Green, Reggie Bullock, and Sterling Brown.

Who are the best shooting guards in Dallas Mavericks history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Dallas Mavericks shooting guard of all time!

Birthplace : Seattle, Washington

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Dallas Mavericks

Position : Point guard, Shooting guard

Dallas Mavericks: 2004-2012

Originally traded to the Mavericks in 2004, Jason Terry quickly became a fan favorite due to his relentless energy and commitment to the team. Known for his quickness and deadly three-point shooting ability, Terry was a crucial piece in the Mavericks' 2011 championship run, also earning the NBA Sixth Man of the Year award in 2009. His tenacious play and ability to ignite a spark off the bench made him a key component of Dallas' success during his time there.

Birthplace : Daytona Beach, Florida

Nationality : American

Team : Toronto Raptors, New Jersey Nets, Orlando Magic, Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks

Position : Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2011-2014

Coming to the Dallas Mavericks via free agency in 2011, Vince Carter instantly made his mark as one of the best shooting guards to ever don a Mavs jersey. With an explosive style of play and a keen ability to score in a variety of ways, Carter consistently provided clutch performances during tight games. Although his time in Dallas did not result in any major individual awards or championships, his impact on the court and leadership in the locker room remain testaments to his greatness.

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 1996-2005

Drafted by the Phoenix Suns in 1995, Michael Finley would eventually join the Dallas Mavericks via trade in 1996 and would go on to become one of the franchise's most prolific scorers. As a silky-smooth creator with a knack for scoring from anywhere on the floor, Finley consistently delivered memorable performances in a Mavs uniform. Throughout his illustrious tenure in Dallas, he earned two All-Star selections, solidifying his place among the team's all-time greats.

Birthplace : Panama City, Panama

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard

Dallas Mavericks: 1981-1992

Arguably one of the most iconic players in franchise history, Rolando Blackman was drafted by the Mavericks in 1981 and immediately established himself as a dynamic shooting guard. With an elegant mid-range game and unmatched poise in pressure situations, Blackman earned four All-Star appearances during his time with the team. Though his tenure did not result in any championships, his impact on the court and the legacy he left behind remain etched in Dallas Mavericks lore.

Birthplace : Kinston, North Carolina, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Atlanta Hawks

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2004-2009

Acquired via trade in 2004, Jerry Stackhouse brought a tough, no-nonsense attitude to the Dallas Mavericks' backcourt. Renowned for his gritty defense and ability to score in bunches, Stackhouse played an important role in the team's successful playoff runs during the mid-2000s. While he didn't gain any individual accolades during his time in Dallas, his contributions to the franchise are fondly remembered by Mavericks fans.

Birthplace : Toledo, Ohio

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard

Dallas Mavericks: 1992-1997

Drafted by the Mavericks in 1992, Jim Jackson wasted no time asserting himself as a premier shooting guard in the league. With an arsenal of offensive moves and a keen sense for finding open teammates, Jackson was named to the NBA All-Rookie First Team. Though his time with Dallas was marred by off-court controversies, his on-court performance and versatility continue to be appreciated by Mavs enthusiasts.
